title: Nightly ICE: Using function pointer as reg argument in asm! macro causes rustc panic

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Encountered while compiling my UEFI boot-loader project. ### Issue reproduction code ```Rust pub type Yes = extern "sysv64" fn(&'static u8) -> !; fn main() { unsafe { let yes = &6 as *const _ as *const Yes; core::arch::asm!("call {}", in(reg) yes, options(noreturn)); } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.63.0-nightly (ebbcbfc23 2022-05-27) binary: rustc commit-hash: ebbcbfc236ced21d5e6a92269edb704692ff26b8 commit-date: 2022-05-27 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.63.0-nightly LLVM version: 14.0.4 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 0 but the index is 120', /Users/runner/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/ena-0.14.0/src/snapshot_vec.rs:199:10 ```
Backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: _rust_begin_unwind 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt 2: core::panicking::panic_bounds_check 3: >, &mut rustc_infer::infer::undo_log::InferCtxtUndoLogs>>>::uninlined_get_root_key 4: ::fold_region 5: ::super_fold_with:: 6: <&rustc_middle::ty::list::List as rustc_middle::ty::fold::TypeFoldable>::try_fold_with:: 7: ::super_fold_with:: 8: <&rustc_middle::ty::list::List as rustc_middle::ty::fold::TypeFoldable>::try_fold_with:: 9: ::try_fold_with:: 10: as rustc_middle::ty::fold::TypeFoldable>::fold_with:: 11: ::canonicalize::> 12: ::evaluate_obligation 13: ::evaluate_obligation_no_overflow 14: rustc_trait_selection::traits::type_known_to_meet_bound_modulo_regions 15: ::enter:: 16: rustc_ty_utils::common_traits::is_item_raw 17: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::, bool>> 18: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 19: ::is_copy_modulo_regions 20: ::check_asm_operand_type 21: ::check_asm 22: ::check_asms 23: ::enter::<&rustc_middle::ty::context::TypeckResults, ::enter::{closure#1}, &rustc_middle::ty::context::TypeckResults>::{closure#0}> 24: rustc_typeck::check::typeck 25: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 26: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 27: ::par_body_owners:: 28: rustc_typeck::check::typeck_item_bodies 29: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 30: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 31: ::time::<(), rustc_typeck::check_crate::{closure#7}> 32: rustc_typeck::check_crate 33: rustc_interface::passes::analysis 34: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::>> 35: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 36: ::enter::> 37: ::enter::, rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>> 38: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#1}> 39: rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}> 40: >::set::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>> note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.63.0-nightly (ebbcbfc23 2022-05-27) running on x86_64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: --crate-type bin -C opt-level=3 -C lto -Z unstable-options note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [is_copy_raw] computing whether `extern "sysv64" fn(&kaboom::Explosion) -> !` is `Copy` #1 [typeck] type-checking `efi_main` #2 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies #3 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack ```
